title: How to Clean Labels

steps.headline: Soak the container in very hot dishwater first, to soften up the label.
steps.description: You can add some white vinegar to the water also. It will help dissolve the glue.

steps.headline: Once it has soaked for about 15 minutes, peel off as much of the label as you can.
steps.description: If the middle stubbornly remains dry brush it with metal brush (be careful not to tear the paper) and soak again.

steps.headline: You will probably have some glue residue.
steps.description: There are two ways to remove this. Try rubbing some salad or vegetable oil into the glue, and use a paper towel to wipe it until it comes completely off of the container. Let the oil sit for awhile. Use a product like Goo Gone or Goof Off. They will remove the glue residue easily. Just follow the instructions on the container.

steps.headline: Wash the container thoroughly with hot soapy dishwater after either of these methods.
Remove a label off of something you can't soak in water.
steps.description:
Soak a paper towel in hot vinegar and place the dampened paper towel over the label. Allow it to sit there for about 15 minutes to soften the label. Then peel off what you can. You may have to repeat this step once or twice to get all of the label off. Follow the same steps above for removing the glue residue. The Goo Gone works well in this instance. Just a little dab on a paper towel and a little rubbing. text:
Soak the container in very hot dishwater first, to soften up the label. You can add some white vinegar to the water also. It will help dissolve the glue. Once it has soaked for about 15 minutes, peel off as much of the label as you can. If the middle stubbornly remains dry brush it with metal brush (be careful not to tear the paper) and soak again. You will probably have some glue residue. There are two ways to remove this. Try rubbing some salad or vegetable oil into the glue, and use a paper towel to wipe it until it comes completely off of the container. Let the oil sit for awhile. Use a product like Goo Gone or Goof Off. They will remove the glue residue easily. Just follow the instructions on the container. Wash the container thoroughly with hot soapy dishwater after either of these methods. Remove a label off of something you can't soak in water. Soak a paper towel in hot vinegar and place the dampened paper towel over the label. Allow it to sit there for about 15 minutes to soften the label. Then peel off what you can. You may have to repeat this step once or twice to get all of the label off. Follow the same steps above for removing the glue residue. The Goo Gone works well in this instance. Just a little dab on a paper towel and a little rubbing.
